title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that the Intertropical Convergence Zone (where winds from the Northern Hemisphere and Southern Hemisphere converge) affects the island’s weather.

title: Trump ‘thinks’ Zelensky ready to give up Crimea to Russia
byline: US President Donald Trump has said he thinks his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelensky is willing to give up Crimea to Russia as part of a peace deal - despite Kyiv’s previous rejections of any such proposal.

title: Ex-President Ranil to appear before Bribery Comm. today
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe is scheduled to appear before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) today (28) at 9.30 a.m.

title: EU’s GSP+ Monitoring Mission to arrive in Sri Lanka today
byline: A European Union (EU) GSP+ Monitoring Mission is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka today (28).

title: Third day of postal voting commences for 2025 LG Polls
byline: Today marks the third day of postal voting for the upcoming Local Government (LG) elections.

title: New burden-free education system to be launched for Grade 1 and 6 from 2026 – PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that teacher recruitment in the past had not been conducted in an appropriate manner, and that in the future, teachers would be recruited based on actual vacancies.

title: Devotees, residents & volunteers join hands to clean Kandy City
byline: The historic city of Kandy was thoroughly cleansed with the collective efforts of devotees visiting the “Siri Dalada Vandanawa” special exposition, alongside residents and volunteers from the area, as part of the ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ programme, the President’s Media Division said.

title: Ex-President Ranil arrives at Bribery Commission
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has arrived at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) a short while ago, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: 2025 LG Polls: 30 candidates arrested for violating election laws
byline: A total of 30 candidates have been arrested so far for violating election laws in connection with the 2025 Local Government (LG) election, according to Sri Lanka Police.

title: Trial begins in Paris over 2016 gunpoint robbery of Kim Kardashian
byline: Ten suspects go on trial in Paris on Monday over the 2016 robbery of the US celebrity Kim Kardashian, which saw some $10 million worth of jewellery stolen from the reality TV star and influencer.

title: Appeals Court rejects ex-State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera’s writ petition
byline: The Court of Appeal has dismissed, without taking up for hearing, a writ petition filed by former State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera seeking an order to prevent his arrest in connection with a case against the alleged illegal acquisition of state land under the jurisdiction of the Kelaniya Divisional Secretariat.

title: Yemen’s Houthi rebels allege US airstrike hit a prison holding African migrants
byline: Yemen’s Houthi rebels on Monday alleged a U.S. airstrike hit a prison holding African migrants, killing and wounding some of the 100 inmates held there.

title: Vatican closes Sistine Chapel to the public and prepares for papal conclave
byline: Exit tourists. Enter cardinals.The Vatican has closed the Sistine Chapel, where cardinals will gather for the conclave to elect the next pope after the death of Pope Francis on April 21 at age 88.

title: Japan’s Nintendo fans test Switch 2 ahead of launch amid tariff worries
byline: Nintendo fans were given a chance to try out the company’s new Switch 2 gaming device at an event near Tokyo on Saturday, ahead of a release that some worry could be overshadowed by tariffs driving up prices.

title: Ex-President Sirisena testifies in 2008 Boralesgamuwa suicide bombing case
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena, who was named as a witness in the case concerning an attempted suicide bomb attack in Boralesgamuwa in 2008, gave evidence before the Colombo High Court today (28).

title: 1 in 5 tourist arrivals in April from India, new data reveals
byline: Nearly 30,000 Indian nationals have arrived in the country during the month of April, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority shows.

title: Exam Dept. facilitates online access for candidates to download A/L result sheets
byline: The Department of Examinations announced today (28) that facilities have been made available for all school and private candidates of 2024 (2025) G.C.E. Advance Level Examination to access their examination results sheets online.

title: India, Pakistan exchange small arms fire across Kashmir border for fourth night
byline: India said on Monday it had responded to ‘unprovoked’ firing from Pakistan along the de facto border for the fourth consecutive night, as it deepens its search for militants in the region following last week’s deadly attack on tourists in Kashmir.

title: Ex-President Ranil leaves Bribery Commission after giving statement
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has left the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) after providing a statement, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Australia’s ruling party to hike student visa fees again in pre-election pledge
byline: Australia’s ruling Labor Party said on Monday it would raise visa fees for international students to A$2,000 ($1,279) if reelected, the latest measure aimed at the lucrative education sector that has been a major source of immigration.

title: New reforms including mandatory seat belts for bus drivers proposed
byline: A number of reforms including the installation of GPS and CCTV systems in buses and making seat belts mandatory for bus drivers have been proposed during a stakeholder meeting.

title: Five sentenced to death over 2012 youth murder in Colombo
byline: The Colombo High Court today (28) imposed the death penalty on five individuals for the brutal killing of a 21-year-old youth adjacent to a temple in Mattakkuliya in 2012.

title: Heroic troops save lives of mother and child caught in strong river currents
byline: A mother and her child who were caught in strong down currents in the Menik Ganga near the Sellakatharagama Dewalaya have been rescued by troops of the Sri Lanka National Guard.

title: Foreigner’s parcel causes bomb scare at Russian Embassy in Colombo
byline: A parcel left behind by a foreign national at the Russian Embassy in Colombo has created panic among staff who had promptly called the bomb disposal squad to its premises this afternoon (28).
